text.name: sys_description
text.text: Released in 1984 to replace the VIC-20, the Commodore C116, C16 and Plus / 4 range targeted the entry-level market. A MOS7501 or 8501 processor succeeds the 6502 and is 75% faster. However only one TED co-processor is included for audio and video. Also unlike the C64, no hardware acceleration exists on these machines. The Plus / 4 has 32k of RAM and integrates four office applications into it. This project was a commercial failure in the USA and stopped in 1985 even if copies were sold in Europe and especially in the east, behind the iron curtain.
